concept-wr.title: Password Recovery for Linux User Accounts
concept-wr.shortdesc: You can reset the password for a Linux user if required. The procedure depends on the class of user.

If no other Linux system user accounts have been created, then password recovery for wrsroot is not possible, and you must reinstall the Titanium Server software.

section.title: LDAP System Users
section.p: This class includes users created using LDAP utilities.
You can reset the password for an LDAP account as follows:

codeblock.userinput: sudo ldapmodifyuser user replace userPassword temp_password

section.p: where user is the user name, and temp_password is a temporary password. The second command forces a password change on first login.
